This article discusses the 1977 instrumental hit single “Theme from Close Encounters of the Third Kind” by John Williams, the main theme from the movie soundtrack. It details its chart performance, competition with other versions, and a Grammy win.

Charts ðŸ”—

This section presents the peak chart positions of the single in various countries and charts during 1977 and 1978. It includes weekly charts from Australia (Kent Music Report), Canada (RPM Top Singles and Adult Contemporary), Italy (FIMI), and the US (Billboard Hot 100, Adult Contemporary, and Cash Box Top 100). It also lists year-end chart positions in Canada (RPM Top Singles) and the US (Joel Whitburn’s Pop Annual).

This section mentions that Gene Page recorded a disco version of “Close Encounters of the Third Kind” in 1977, which peaked at #30 on the R&B chart in 1978.
